dict.acceptation: 兴奋，激动；令人兴奋的事；刺激，振奋；

sent.orig: This is what Freud seems to mean when he distinguishes internal excitement from external excitement.
sent.trans: 这似乎就是佛洛伊德的意思，当他区别内在的兴奋跟外在的兴奋。

sent.orig: It is a feeling of restlessness or excitement excitement brought on by the coming of spring.
sent.trans: 这并不是一个真正的疾病，而是由春天临近所产生的烦躁或兴奋之感。

sent.orig: Butterfly in great excitement looks through a telescope and recognizes Pinkerton's ship, the Abraham Lincoln.
sent.trans: 蝴蝶激动异常地在望远镜中认出这是平克顿的军舰阿伯拉罕·林肯号。

sent.orig: His flushed face witnessed the great excitement he felt.
sent.trans: 他通红的脸孔表明他很激动。

sent.orig: After the excitement was over, she felt flat.
sent.trans: 令人兴奋的事过后，她感到平淡无味。
